definitions.definition: A male given name originating from the Bible [in turn from Hebrew] ; very popular since the Middle Ages.

subdefinitions.definition: Used generically for a man whose actual name may not be known.
examples: a John Doe murder case; the dreaded Dear John letter; if we were to ask John Q. Public his opinion

subdefinitions.definition: Used frequently to form an idea personified, as in John Bull , John Barleycorn (see derivations below).

definitions.definition: Persons of the Christian Bible: John the Baptist ; and names  possibly referring to one, two or three persons, frequently called "Saint": John the Apostle , John the Evangelist and John of Patmos (also called John the Divine or John the Theologian).
The Gospel of St. John, a book of the New Testament of the Bible . Traditionally the fourth of the four gospels .
One of the books in the New Testament of the Bible , the epistles of John ( 1 John , 2 John and 3 John ).
A surname originating as a patronymic .
